items.summary: Show a modal login popup automatically on page load for first-time visitors who are not authenticated. The popup must appear only once per browser (persist a flag in localStorage), and it must include a clear call-to-action button that triggers Internet Identity login via the existing `useInternetIdentity().login()` function (must be invoked by a user click, not automatically).

Add a login icon/button to the header in `frontend/src/components/TimerScreen.tsx` that opens the same login modal later on demand. The header control must be visible and usable after the initial popup has been suppressed.

Create a reusable login modal component (new file) that encapsulates the modal UI and uses `useInternetIdentity` for login status and actions, and integrate it into `TimerScreen` for both first-visit auto-open behavior and header-triggered open behavior.
